content.description: Start matched on an awkward slope with feet on Sheen boulder and reach up to the right for a three finger crimp. Shift weight and make a far grab up for a slope that you match, carefully bringing weight under you. Throw around the left side to a two finger crimp and bring your right foot up to the ledge. Slowly crawl up and grab one last comfortable hold right before topping out.
content.protection: Crash pad. Lots of nearby rocks.
content.location: Tallest and left-most of the Trinity Force boulders.

content.description: Start with an undercling for the right and a side pull on the left. Work your way up with the left until it is comfortable to find the somewhat juggy slopers for both hands. Move your feet up high to great foot chips and trust your hands to reach for the top.
content.location: Middle of the Trinity Force boulders.

content.description: Starting with a crimpy left side pull and a low Gaston, work your way up using small crimps or large dynamic moves until you reach the slope-like section with hands. Reach around the right for an under cling and use it to work your way up to the top out.
content.protection: Crash Pad. Nearby rocks are perfectly placed where you'll want to fall.
content.location: The right-most rock of the Trinity Force boulders.

content.description: Route is a sit start on a crimp and a sloper with both feet to the left. Route goes two holds to the right then up the dark color of the face. Route has a good mix of pinches and crimps with a jug to finish. Route can be topped out and then walk off to the right or down climb a few holds and jump off.
content.protection: Good landing if for a crash pad
content.location: From the street where you park look directly up the hill. The boulder does not look obvious. There is a small path that leads to the boulder.
